tests.name: Depression Screening Test (PHQ-9)
tests.description: The Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ-9) is a self-administered depression scale used for screening, diagnosing, monitoring, and measuring the severity of depression.
tests.instructions: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems?

questions.text: Little interest or pleasure in doing things

ranges.description: Your symptoms are not indicative of depression.
You may be experiencing mild depression. Consider discussing these feelings with a healthcare provider.
You may be experiencing moderate depression. It's recommended to consult with a mental health professional.
You may be experiencing moderately severe depression. Please consider seeking professional help soon.
You may be experiencing severe depression. It's strongly recommended to seek professional help immediately.

tests.name: Generalized Anxiety Disorder Test (GAD-7)
tests.description: The GAD-7 is a self-reported questionnaire for screening and measuring the severity of generalized anxiety disorder.
tests.instructions: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by the following problems?

questions.text: Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge
Not being able to stop or control worrying

ranges.description: Your symptoms are not indicative of anxiety.
You may be experiencing mild anxiety. Consider discussing these feelings with a healthcare provider.
You may be experiencing moderate anxiety. It's recommended to consult with a mental health professional.
You may be experiencing severe anxiety. It's strongly recommended to seek professional help.

tests.name: Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test (AUDIT)
tests.description: The AUDIT is a screening tool developed by the World Health Organization (WHO) to assess alcohol consumption, drinking behaviors, and alcohol-related problems.
tests.instructions: Please select the answer that is correct for you during the past year.

questions.text: How often do you have a drink containing alcohol?
How many drinks containing alcohol do you have on a typical day when you are drinking?

ranges.description: Your drinking patterns appear to be low-risk.
Your drinking patterns suggest a moderate risk. Consider discussing with a healthcare provider.
Your drinking patterns suggest a high risk. It's recommended to seek professional help.
Your drinking patterns suggest a severe risk. Please seek professional help immediately.

tests.name: Insomnia Severity Index (ISI)
tests.description: The Insomnia Severity Index is a brief screening measure to assess the severity of both nighttime and daytime components of insomnia.
tests.instructions: For each question, please select the number that best describes your sleep patterns in the last two weeks.

questions.text: How severe are your current sleep problems?
How satisfied/dissatisfied are you with your current sleep pattern?

ranges.description: Your responses do not suggest clinically significant insomnia.
You may be experiencing mild sleep difficulties.
You may be experiencing moderate clinical insomnia.
You may be experiencing severe clinical insomnia.

tests.name: McLean Screening Instrument for BPD (MSI-BPD)
tests.description: The MSI-BPD is a 10-item screening measure for Borderline Personality Disorder (BPD).
tests.instructions: Please answer yes or no to the following questions about how you have felt and behaved over the past 2 years.

questions.text: Have you often become frantic when you thought that someone you really cared about was going to leave you?
Have your relationships with people you really care about had lots of extreme ups and downs?

ranges.description: Your responses suggest that BPD traits are unlikely.
Your responses suggest possible BPD traits. Consider professional evaluation.
Your responses suggest likely BPD traits. It's recommended to seek professional evaluation.
